oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff - Bob Allen Interview 1983
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Roy Acuff by Bob Allen. The recording takes place on 10/05/1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:01) -- Bob Allen introduction, Roy Acuff mentions that he had a brother-in-law named Bob Allen. (0:20) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about his new place of residence. Roy Acuff explains that he is often bothered by fans knocking on his door. (2:46) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff if he enjoys speaking with fans at Opryland. (4:10) -- Roy Acuff speaks about the struggles of Opryland in 1980. (5:08) -- Roy Acuff mentions a building he purchased in Madison, TN for accommodating his visiting friends. (5:48) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about his current daily schedule. (7:15) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff if he still gets the same enjoyment when performing on The Grand Ole Opry today (1980). Roy Acuff mentions that he possesses higher confidence as a performer today compared to his younger days of performing on the Opry. (8:35) -- Bob Allen asks about Roy Acuff's first audition with The Grand Ole Opry. (9:57) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff if he ever returns to his place of birth, Maynardville, TN. (11:31) -- Roy Acuff mentions that the house he was born in was recently torn down. (12:00) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about the personnel of The Smoky Mountain Boys. (13:40) -- Roy Acuff mentions that he recently stopped touring. (14:00) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about what music inspired him to pick up a fiddle. (15:56) -- Roy Acuff speaks about how he learned to balance certain objects on the farm growing up. This is how he learned how to balance his fiddle. (17:08) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about the current state of country music. (18:50) -- Bob Allen mentions whether Roy Acuff's ever used an electric instrument in his group. (19:09) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about the origins of the song "Great Speckled Bird." Roy Acuff explains that he heard someone in Knoxville singing it, then decided to bring to The Grand Ole Opry. (21:01) -- Roy Acuff explains the uniqueness of his voice when he first came to The Grand Ole Opry. (22:00) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff where he developed his signature vocal style. (22:21) -- Roy Acuff mentions that he was influenced by church vocalists growing up. (24:16) -- Roy Acuff speaks about singing religious hymns and tunes. (25:26) -- Roy Acuff speaks on why he first came to Nashville. (28:16) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about the past 45 years. (29:40) -- Bob Allen asks about the original Grand Ole Opry.
